intro: [WRONG START] Piloselloodes cordata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, serrated leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist to wet environments such as marshes and swamps. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. Piloselloides cordata is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for wildlife.
